Run the DBI queries inside against a mocked db

Source: R/mock-db.R
with_mock_db.Rd

When testing with dittodb, wrap your tests in with_mock_db({}) to use the database fixtures. dittodb will look for fixtures in all entries of .db_mock_paths.

with_mock_db(expr)

Arguments

expr

the expression to execute

Value

nothing

Details

Connections should be made inside of with_mock_db() because dittodb uses the database name (given in dbname or Database argument of dbConnect depending on the driver) to separate different fixtures.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
with_mock_db({
  con <- dbConnect(
    RPostgreSQL::PostgreSQL(),
    dbname = "nycflights",
    host = "127.0.0.1",
    user = "travis",
    password = ""
  )

  test_that("We get one airline", {
    one_airline <- dbGetQuery(
      con,
      "SELECT carrier, name FROM airlines LIMIT 1"
    )
    expect_is(one_airline, "data.frame")
    expect_equal(nrow(one_airline), 1)
    expect_equal(one_airline$carrier, "9E")
    expect_equal(one_airline$name, "Endeavor Air Inc.")
  })
})
}
